body: Hi Sergio, The same problem :-( stable-x86_64-apple-darwin unchanged - rustc 1.26.0 (a77568041 2018-05-07) nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin unchanged - rustc 1.28.0-nightly (952f344cd 2018-05-18) rustup override set nightly rustup update && cargo update But no results:

Having the same problem, tried to downgrade to version 0.3.6, cargo does not like this. 

Running the following nightly version:
- cargo 1.28.0-nightly (f352115d5 2018-05-15)
- rustc 1.28.0-nightly (952f344cd 2018-05-18)

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11871820/40268383-941e1efa-5b6c-11e8-92a5-70b20cd0283a.PNG)

my temporary solution is to downgrade:
```bash
rustup toolchain install nightly-2018-05-17
rustup default nightly-2018-05-17
```

Looks like something has changed with type inference, but I can't tell what. Changing https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/blob/v0.3/lib/src/http/header.rs#L544 from `val.borrow()` to `&**val` (which is what `Cow::borrow()` does anyway) appears to compile successfully.

EDIT: hypothetical reason for the error -- `Header::new` wants any `Into<Cow<'_, str>>`, and there might be multiple valid things to `borrow()` out of a `Cow<'_, str>` especially given that it impls `Deref`. `Borrow::<str>::borrow(val)` is another way to resolve the ambiguity.

issue.title: Fix #643

labels.name: pr: merged
labels.description: This pull request was merged manually.

issue.body:
Fixes #643

`Deref` of a `Cow<'_, str>` will always yield a `str`, so this should resolve any ambiguity during type inference.

body:
Downgrading fixed the problem

Try this: `rustup override set nightly-2018-05-17`

Fixed in ff5db841114d8da1a17b723808501c756df57c64. Will push a new release with this fix soon.

Edit: Released in v0.3.11.

issue.title: Updates for latest nightly

Resolves #646.

Includes fix for #643 on master branch.

issue.title: cannot resolve `std::borrow::Cow<'_, str>: std::borrow::Borrow<_>`

repository.name: rust
repository.description: Empowering everyone to build reliable and efficient software.

issue.title: Fixed to work with new version of rust nightly

repository.name: rust-reactjs
repository.description: This is an example of using a backend based on Rust Rocket project and a Client side app based on ReactJs (+ Webpack, Babel stack)

issue.body: The current version of `rustc 1.35.0 nightly` fails to compile `rocket 0.1.4` (see [#643](https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/issues/643)) this can be solved by changing the version of rocket in the `Cargo.toml` file. Unfortunately, doing so breaks other things so a couple of changes are required in `main.rs`. Lastly, the version of `webpack` specified in `package.json` is outdated and has a minor security vulnerability, updating to a new version fixes this without breaking anything.
